title: 3 Ways to Enable Location Services in Chrome

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your PC or Mac.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your PC or Mac. This app resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere. You can also do this if you're using a Chromebook or any other laptop.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This vertical three-dot menu in the top-right corner of the Chrome window. A drop-down menu will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is near the bottom of the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy & security.
steps.content: Click Privacy & security . You'll see this in the panel on the left side of the window next to a checkered shield. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and click Site settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Site settings . You'll find this near the bottom of the "Privacy and security" section of options.

steps.title: Click Location.
steps.content: Click Location . It's near the middle of the page under the "Permissions" header.

steps.title: Click the circle next to "Sites can ask for your location" to select it.
steps.content: Click the circle next to "Sites can ask for your location" to select it. This setting will ensure that any site that requests your location will prompt you for permission first. [3] X Research source You can also see the sites that you've either allowed or denied permission to access your location. Click the trashcan icon if you want to reset the location permissions or click the arrow next to a site to change its permissions.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. Tap the grey app with gears on it. You'll usually find Settings on the Home Screen. If you don't have Chrome installed on your iPhone, you won't see this option.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Chrome.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Chrome . You'll find this option in the list of apps near the bottom of the Settings page.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . It's at the top of the Chrome page.

steps.title: Tap While Using the App.
steps.content: Tap While Using the App . Doing so will ensure that Google Chrome can access your phone's location while you're using the app, but not while the app is closed. [4] X Research source There is also a toggle for "Precise Location." Tap that toggle to enable "Precise Location" so Google can use a better location for you.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Tap the Chrome app icon, which resembles a red, yellow, green, and blue sphere.

steps.title: Tap ⋮.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ . This vertical three-dot menu icon is in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so prompts a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is at the bottom of the drop-down menu next to a gear icon.

steps.title: Tap Site settings.
steps.content: Tap Site settings . It's under the "Advanced" section of settings.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . This option is near the top of the page.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Location" to toggle it on .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Location" to toggle it on . If it's blue and pointing to the right, location services are enabled. Google will now track your Android's location while you use the Chrome app, which will allow some sites to send you tailored information. [5] X Research source
